Key Match Events: Tarik Skubal allowed one run on four hits over eight innings and struck out eight without a walk.
Tyler O’Neill’s 25th homer gave the Red Sox a quick lead in the first inning.
Poor defense allowed the Tigers to take the lead against Nick Pivetta in the second inning.
Spencer Torkelson singled with one out and took third on a double down the right-field line by Zach McKinstry.
Trey Sweeney followed with a deep fly ball to left field, resulting in two runs for the Tigers.
Nick Pivetta allowed two runs on six hits, walked one, and struck out six over six innings.
Tyler Holton closed the game for the Tigers, securing the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Red Sox manager Alex Cora praised Tarik Skubal, calling him probably the best pitcher in the American League.
Rob Refsnyder acknowledged he should have made the play that allowed the Tigers to score and apologized to Nick Pivetta.
Tyler O’Neill commented on battling against Skubal and the need for the Red Sox to play better baseball moving forward.
Alex Cora expressed belief in the team's potential to do more and emphasized the importance of playing better baseball.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game finished in 2 hours and 1 minute.
With Minnesota losing, the Red Sox remain 3½ games out in the race for a wild-card berth.
